creator.description:
A labeling service for the games industry. Managed by @trezy.codes.

Labels are applied manually and may be delayed.

locales.description: Anybody that is directly involved in the development of a game. This includes including programmers, designers, narrative, animators, writers, artists, composers, QA, localisation, etc. This is available for any section of the industry, from AAA to indie to hobbyists.
locales.name: Game Dev

locales.description:
Companies that contribute to the development of games. This includes indie studios, AAA studios, consulting and outsourcing companies, etc.

✅ This profile has been independently verified.
locales.name: Game Studio

locales.description: The diligent people that preserve some part of games industry history.
locales.name: Games Archivist

locales.description: Individuals involved with the business side of the games industry. This includes as marketing, PR, publishing, finance, etc.
locales.name: Games Business

locales.description: Professors, instructors, and others involved in educating the games industry.
locales.name: Games Educator

locales.description:
Individual journalists covering the games industry.

✅ This profile has been independently verified.
locales.name: Games Journalist

locales.description: Event organizers that focus on the games industry. Event size is irrelevant; everything from local meetups to international conferences counts.
locales.name: Games Organizer

locales.description: Podcasts about games, as well as individual podcasters.
locales.name: Games Podcast

locales.description:
Physical and digital publications that cover games.

✅ This profile has been independently verified.
locales.name: Games Publication

locales.description:
Companies that have published games.

✅ This profile has been independently verified.
locales.name: Games Publisher

locales.description: Anybody that focuses on researching games and the games industry.
locales.name: Games Research
